meanings.definition: The quality or state of being spiky.
meanings.sent1: The spikinesses of the cactus made it difficult to touch.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the spikinesses of the porcupine as it brushed against my leg.
meanings.sent3: The spikinesses of the hedgehog made it look like a tiny, walking pincushion.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a spikinesses that could pierce through even the toughest exterior.
meanings.sent5: The spikinesses of the ice crystals glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The presence of spikes or sharp points.
meanings.sent1: I avoided sitting on the chair due to the spikinesses of its backrest.
meanings.sent2: The spikinesses of the barbed wire fence warned trespassers to stay away.
meanings.sent3: The spikinesses of the cactus needles seemed to wave hello in the desert breeze.
meanings.sent4: The spikinesses of her wit could catch you off guard in a conversation.
meanings.sent5: The spikinesses of the thorns protected the delicate rose petals.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a prickly or pointed surface.
meanings.sent1: The spikinesses of the pine cone made it challenging to hold.
meanings.sent2: The spikinesses of the sea urchin's shell provided natural defense.
meanings.sent3: The spikinesses of the caterpillar's hairs tickled my skin as it crawled on me.
meanings.sent4: The spikinesses of the artist's brush strokes added depth to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The spikinesses of the hedge leaves deterred animals from nibbling on them.
